ETYMOLOGY: From Old English nǣfre, from ne 'not' + ǣfre 'ever'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: a word or phrase that modifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: At no time; not on any occasion.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 从不；从未；绝不；在任何时候都不
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I have never seen such a beautiful sight.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我从未见过如此美丽的景象。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: a word or phrase that modifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Not at all; in no way; used to express strong denial or prohibition.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 绝不；一点也不（用于强调否定或禁止）
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Never fear, I'm here to help.

REGISTER: Common usage in all contexts, from informal to formal speech and writing.
